intro: Eschenbachia gouanii, commonly known as the Gouani's spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its diverse morphology and often milky sap. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
